snippet.desc:
An enhanced version of the "Particles" behavior. This behavior will make the actor spawn another actor type (the particle) at fixed intervals, but is enhanced to also center the created particle actor. Like the original, it has options for spawning at a random offset, or in a circumference and different movement modes for the particles. The best part about this behavior is that it also KILLS the particles on its own! 8)

You can activate and deactivate this behavior from other behaviors, by telling the messages StartEmitting and StopEmitting, respectively.

Comes witha custom block that uses the Random spawn mode and To Angle movement mode.
snippet.description:
An enhanced version of the "Particles" behavior. This behavior will make the actor spawn another actor type (the particle) at fixed intervals, but is enhanced to also center the created particle actor. Like the original, it has options for spawning at a random offset, or in a circumference and different movement modes for the particles. The best part about this behavior is that it also KILLS the particles on its own! 8)

You can activate and deactivate this behavior from other behaviors, by telling the messages StartEmitting and StopEmitting, respectively.

Comes witha custom block that uses the Random spawn mode and To Angle movement mode.
snippet.name: Enhanced Particle System

actortype.desc: The type of particle to emit. It will be created in a random position, based on the actor's position, and the maximum and minimum offset values.
actortype.name: _ParticleType

number.desc: X Minimum Offset if Random mode is selected.
number.name: _XMinimumOffset

number.desc: X Maximum Offset if Random mode is selected.
number.name: _XMaximumOffset

number.desc: Y Minimum Offset if Random mode is selected.
number.name: _YMinimumOffset

number.desc: X Maximum Offset if Random mode is selected.
number.name: _YMaximumOffset

text.desc:
The type of movement the particles will perform:

To Angle: the particles will go towards the specified angle.
Expand: the particles will go away from the actor.
To Center: the particles will go to the center of the actor.
To Point: the particles will go to a specific point based on the actor's position and an offset.
No Movement: The particle won't move

Tip 1: Select random and make all the Offset values to match the center of the actor for a centralized expand effect.
Tip 2: You can make the particle actor affected by gravity for a different effect.
text.dropdown: To Angle=To Angle Expand=Expand To Center=To Center To Point=To Point No Movement=No Movement
text.name: _MovementMode

boolean.desc: If checked, the actor will start the scene emitting particles.
boolean.name: _Activated

number.desc: Delay between particles.
number.name: _ParticleDelay

boolean.desc: If "true", the particle is in "delay" mode for "Particle Delay" seconds.
boolean.name: _InParticleDelay

number.desc: Force to push the particles.
number.name: _ParticleForce

number.desc: A special type of offset. If you select To Point mode, you can make the particles travel to a specific point based on the actor's coordinates and this offset.
number.name: _ToPointXOffset

number.desc: A special type of offset. If you select To Point mode, you can make the particles travel to a specific point based on the actor's coordinates and this offset.
number.name: _ToPointYOffset

number.desc: Radius of the perimeter if Perimeter mode is set.
number.name: _Radius

text.desc:
How will the particles be spawned:
Random: Spawn at a random offset based on the minimum and maximum offsets.
Perimeter: Spawn at a perimeter around the actor.
text.name: _SpawnModes

number.desc:
Angle to move if the Movement Mode is set "To Angle".

For reference:
-90 = Up
0 = Right
90 = Down
180 = Left
number.name: _AngletoMove

number.desc: Maximum force to push the particles. If Random Speed is not checked, Maximum Particle Force is going to be used.
number.name: _MaximumParticleForce

boolean.desc: If checked, the particles will be pushed at a random speed.
boolean.name: _RandomSpeed

text.desc: Name of the particle, used for setting the particle type from the Particle List.
text.name: _ParticleName

number.desc: Minimum Force to push the particles.
number.name: _MinimumParticleForce

boolean.desc: If checked, will select the particles to be created based on the list.
boolean.name: _RandomParticles

list.desc: List with the name of the particles that can be created.
list.name: _ParticleList

number.desc: Particle "time to live" (in seconds), before recycling it.
number.name: _ParticleTTL

number.desc: The new opacity of the particle after a period of time.
number.name: _FinalOpacity

number.desc: The final width, in percent of the original width.
number.name: _FinalPercentageWidth

number.desc: The final height, in percent of the original width.
number.name: _FinalPercentageHeight

number.desc:
The minimum rotation force for random rotations. Negative or positive numbers are used to change opposite directions.

Note: Make sure the physics is setup correctly to allow rotations.
number.name: _MinimumRotationForce

number.desc:
The maximum rotation force for random rotations. Negative or positive numbers are used to change opposite directions.

Note: Make sure the physics is setup correctly to allow rotations.
number.name: _MaximumRotationForce

list.desc: A place for completed particles (to be reycled).
list.name: _ParticleBin

snippet.desc: This behavior allows you to draw the collision shapes, orientation, velocity and ID of all actors on screen, as well as the mouse position. It also has an option to change the game speed in Flash.
snippet.description: This behavior allows you to draw the collision shapes, orientation, velocity and ID of all actors on screen, as well as the mouse position. It also has an option to change the game speed in Flash.
snippet.name: Game Debugger

boolean.desc: If selected, debug drawing and the other drawing options will be enabled.
boolean.name: _Enabled

number.desc: Stroke thickness used for drawing collision shapes, orientation and velocity.
number.name: _StrokeThickness

boolean.desc: If selected, a line will be drawn for each actor on screen, pointing from the center of the actor to the direction the actor is facing.
boolean.name: _DrawOrientation

boolean.desc: If selected, a line will be drawn from the center of each actor on screen, representing the current velocity. The line points in the direction of the velocity, and the length of the line indicates the speed.
boolean.name: _DrawVelocity

number.desc: The horizontal offset at which the actor type and ID will be drawn.
number.name: _ActorIDXOffset

number.desc: The vertical offset at which the actor type and ID will be drawn.
number.name: _ActorIDYOffset

boolean.desc: If selected, the actor type and ID of each actor on screen will be drawn.
boolean.name: _DrawActorIDs

boolean.desc: If selected, actors with disabled physics will not draw orientation, velocity or ID. This is useful to exclude GUI elements from these debug drawing features.
boolean.name: _ExcludeLightweightActors

boolean.desc:
If selected, the mouse coordinates will be relative to the scene.
Otherwise the mouse coordinates will be relative to the screen.
boolean.name: _MouseasSceneCoordinates

number.desc: The vertical offset from the mouse position at which the mouse coordinates will be drawn.
number.name: _MouseYOffset

number.desc: The horizontal offset from the mouse position at which the mouse coordinates will be drawn.
number.name: _MouseXOffset

control.desc: Use this control to toggle the game debugger on/off at runtime.
control.name: _ToggleControl

boolean.desc: If selected, the coordinates of the mouse cursor will be drawn.
boolean.name: _DrawMousePosition

control.desc:
Pressing this control will make the game run at half the current speed.
The minimum speed is one forth of the normal speed.
If you decrease the speed below the normal speed, the user input might not be recognized all the time.
Changing game speed is only supported in Flash, not it iOS.
control.name: _DecreaseGameSpeedControl

control.desc:
Pressing this control will make the game run at twice the current game speed.
Only speed up to four times of the normal speed is possible.
Changing game speed is only supported in Flash, not it iOS.
control.name: _IncreaseGameSpeedControl

control.desc:
Holding down this key will reset the game speed to the default speed.
If you decrease the game speed, and key presses are not recognized, hold down this key to reset the game speed.
control.name: _ResetGameSpeedControl

color.desc: The color used to draw the collision shapes.
color.name: _DebugDrawingColor

color.desc:
The color of the font used for drawing the actor IDs and the mouse position.
This option works only in Flash.
color.name: _FontColor

font.desc: The font used for drawing the actor IDs and the mouse position.
font.name: _Font

color.desc: The color of the velocity line.
color.name: _VelocityColor

color.desc: The color of the orientation line.
color.name: _OrientationColor

color.desc: A color attribute that can be used in other behaviors for debug drawing. It is not used in this behavior.
color.name: _CustomColor
